name: Dwight McGlothern
bio: Spent his freshman and sophomore seasons at LSU (2020-21) before transferring to Arkansas for his final two seasons (2022-23).
In his career, started 25 of the 38 games he played, totaling 113 tackles, including six for loss, four forced fumbles, 31 passes defensed and eight interceptions (one went for a touchdown).
Led Arkansas in interceptions in both 2023 (three) and 2022 (four). His four interceptions ranked second in the SEC in 2022.
Highest graded cornerback among all Power 5 programs and second nationally according to Pro Football Focus with a 91.3 grade in 2023.
Led all cornerbacks nationally with a 91.8 coverage grade according to PFF and allowed just 12 receptions on 25 targets for 132 yards during his senior season.

Start all 13 games at CB during his first season with the Razorbacks in 2022. Posted single-season career highs in tackles (52), interceptions (four), forced fumbles (two), fumbles recovered (one) and passes defended (10).
As a sophomore at LSU in 2021, registered 32 tackles, six pass breakups, one forced fumble, one interception and a touchdown.

name: Michael Jurgens
bio: Minnesota's fourth selection out of Wake Forest all-time and the first Demon Deacon pick by the Vikings since G Chris DeGear was selected in the fifth round (161st overall) in the 2010 NFL Draft.

name: Theo Jackson
bio: Saw action in 15 games for the Vikings in 2023, recording 16 tackles, an interception and one pass defensed.
Inactive Week 17 against Green Bay (12/31) and Week 18 at Detroit (1/7) due to injury.
Notched two defensive tackles in Week 16 against Detroit (12/24).
Had a pair of tackles on special teams at Las Vegas in Week 14 (12/10).
Recorded his first-career interception in Week 2 at Philadelphia (9/14), also adding four tackles.
Played one defensive snap and appeared mainly on special teams on vs. Tampa Bay (9/10).

name: Jordan Addison
bio: 10th USC wide receiver drafted in the first round in franchise history, and the first Trojan WR to go in the first round since Nelson Agholor in 2015. He was the ninth WR drafted by the Vikings in the first round.
Became the 13th rookie in NFL history and the fifth since 2000 to record at least 900 receiving yards and 10 receiving touchdowns in his rookie season.

Among all rookies in a single season in Vikings history, his 70 receptions rank second and his 911 yards, third. Only WR Justin Jefferson had more receptions as a rookie (88), and only Jefferson (1,400) and WR Randy Moss (1,313) had more receiving yards in their rookie seasons.
Tied Sammy White (1976) for the second-most receiving touchdowns by a rookie in a single season with 10, trailing only Randy Moss (17).

name: Fabian Moreau
bio: Has played for the Washington Commanders (2017-2020), Atlanta Falcons (2021), New York Giants (2022) and Denver Broncos (2023).
Started in 56 of 106 career games played, recording 298 tackles (211 solo), five tackles for loss, seven interceptions, 42 passes defensed and three forced fumbles.
Has played in three postseason games (two starts), combining for four tackles (three solo).

name: Joshua Metellus
bio: One of five players in the league in 2023 with at least four forced fumbles, 2.0 sacks and an interception (Bobby Okereke, Fred Warner, T.J. Watt and Antoine Winfield, Jr.). Just the third Viking in team history to achieve this stat line in a single season, joining Jared Allen (twice, 2009 and 2011) and Antoine Winfield, Sr., (2008).
Named Vikings 2020 Special Teams Player of the Year as part of annual Minnesota Football Honors program.
Was elevated from practice squad to 53-man roster and played in first-career game at Indianapolis (9/20/20).

name: Pat Jones II
bio: Contributed on both defense and special teams in each of the Vikings 17 games, making four starts.
Amassed 31 tackles, including five for loss, 1.0 sack and eight quarterback hurries.
In Week 17 against Green Bay, totaled a career-high nine tackles.

Collected his first sack of the season and the fifth of his career on Christmas Eve against Detroit. Also posted career highs in tackles (six), solo tackles (five), tackles for loss (three) and passes defensed (one).
Made his first career start at Carolina in Week 4 (10/1), recording three tackles, including two for loss.

name: Sammis Reyes
bio: Began playing football in 2021 after spending his collegiate career as a basketball student-athlete, and had played organized football for only one week before joining Washington.
Became first Chilean-born player to play in an NFL game when he made his NFL debut with the Washington Commanders in Week 5 of the 2021 season.
Began playing football in 2021 after spending his collegiate career as a basketball student-athlete, and had played organized football for only one week before joining Washington.

name: Kamu Grugier-Hill
bio: Coached by Defensive Coordinator Brian Flores in New England, who was the Patriots linebackers coach, and was reunited with Flores with the Miami Dolphins in 2020 during Flores time as the Dolphins head coach.
Played for the Philadelphia Eagles (2016-19), Miami Dolphins (2020), Houston Texans (2021-22), Arizona Cardinals (2022) and Carolina Panthers (2023) before coming to Minnesota in 2024.

Prior to joining the Vikings, played in 115 games, making 42 starts, and has recorded 338 total tackles, including 28 for loss, 6.0 sacks, three interceptions, eight passes defensed, four forced fumbles and two fumble recoveries.
Appeared in five postseason contests with the Eagles - three in 2017 and two in 2018 - including playing 80% of special teams snaps during Philadelphia's Super Bowl victory over New England in 2018.
In his career, has kicked off on seven occasions, four times in 2017 with the Eagles and three times in 2023 while playing for the Panthers.

name: Jonathan Greenard
bio: In four seasons with the Texans, started 32 of the 48 games he played and recorded 120 total tackles, including 32 for loss, 23 sacks, one interception (returned for a touchdown), eight passes defensed and three forced fumbles.
Has appeared in two postseason contests, making one start.
One of four players in the NFL to have four games with at least 2.0 sacks during the 2023 season.
Posted single-season career highs in total tackles (52), tackles for loss (15) and sacks (12.5) in 2023.

name: Taki Taimani
bio: In his six-year collegiate career (2018-23), spent four seasons at Washington (2018-21) before transferring to Oregon for two years (2022-23).
At Oregon, played 25 games, tallying 36 total tackles, including 2.5 for loss, one pass defensed and one fumble recovery.
At Washington, appeared in 29 games, recording 71 total tackles, including 3.5 for loss, two passes defensed and one fumble recovery.

name: Brett Rypien
bio: Comes to Minnesota following stints with the Denver Broncos (2019-22), Los Angeles Rams (2023), Seattle Seahawks (2023) and New York Jets (2023).
During the 2023 season, appeared in two games (one start) with the Los Angeles Rams, before signing to the Seattle Seahawks practice squad and finishing the season on the New York Jets active roster.

In his first career start in Week 4 of the 2020 season, was 19-of-31 for a career-high 242 yards and two touchdowns, including a 48-yard touchdown in the second quarter, leading the Broncos to a 37-28 victory over the Jets.

name: Gabriel Murphy
bio: Played three seasons at North Texas (2019-21) before transferring to UCLA for the 2022-23 seasons.
At UCLA, started all 26 games he played and posted 76 total tackles, including 20 for loss, 9.5 sacks, three passes defensed and one fumble recovery.
In 2023, notched single-season career highs in tackles for loss (16) and sacks (8.0) and ranked sixth in the Pac-12 in sacks per game average (0.62)

name: Jeshaun Jones
bio: In his six-year career (2018-23), played in 48 games and recorded 151 receptions for 2,040 yards and 14 touchdowns.
Voted a team captain for the 2023 season.
Led Maryland with single-season career highs in receptions (56), receiving yards (790) and yards per game (60.8) in 2023. Ranked fifth in the Big Ten in each of the three categories.
In 2022, appeared in 13 games with 11 starts and led team in receiving with 44 receptions for 557 yards.
Caught four touchdown passes.
As a true freshman in 2018, scored seven touchdowns (five receiving, two rushing), registering 22 receptions for 288 yards and 18 rushes for 173 yards, as well as a 20-yard passing touchdown.
Had the most receiving touchdowns (five) by a freshman since Stefon Diggs in 2012.
Recorded a passing, rushing and receiving touchdown on each of his first three career touches in his college debut against Texas (9/1/18).

name: Ryan Wright
bio: Appeared in each of the Vikings 17 games in 2023, executing 59 punts for an average of 48.7 yards per punt.
Had four punts in Week 18 at Detroit, averaging 56.0 yards per punt.
Recorded a 68-yard punt in the first quarter against Green Bay in Week 17, the second longest of his career.
In Week 16 against Detroit (12/24), posted the second-best gross punting average of his career (50.0).

Punted the ball eight times at Las Vegas in Week 14 (12/10), tied for the second-most punts in a single game in his career. He downed four punts inside the 20, averaging 47.9 yards per punt with a long of 59.
Registered six punts, averaging 43.0 yards per punt, in Week 10 against New Orleans (11/12). Posted a long of 50.
Had three punts in Week 9 at Atlanta (11/5), downing one inside the 20.
Punted twice at Green Bay in Week 8 (10/29). averaging 43.5 yards per punt.
Recorded one punt for 42 yards against the 49ers in Week 7,
Had five punts at Chicago in Week 6, averaging 49.8 yards per punt. He recorded a long of 63 yards.
Posted a career-best gross punting average of 54.0 at Carolina (10/1).
Recorded a trio of punts against the Chargers (9/24), averaging 48.3 yards per punt and registering one punt inside the 20.

Made his season debut against Tampa Bay (9/10).

name: Jerry Tillery
bio: Spent time with both the Los Angeles Chargers (2019-22) and Las Vegas Raiders (2022-23) before joining the Minnesota Vikings in March of 2024.

Played in 79 career games with 39 starts with the Chargers and Raiders, totaling 147 tackles (76 solo), 12.5 sacks, 14 tackles for loss, three forced fumbles, two fumble recoveries and two passes defensed.

name: Dallas Turner
bio: Minnesota's seventh pick out of Alabama all-time and first since the Vikings selected TE Irv Smith Jr., in 2019.
Second player picked by the Vikings in the first round of an NFL Draft, joining LB Dwayne Rudd (20th overall) in the 1997 NFL Draft.

name: Trent Sherfield Sr.
bio: Originally entered the NFL as an undrafted free agent with the Arizona Cardinals in 2018 out of Vanderbilt.
Joined the Vikings after stints with the Cardinals (2018-20), San Francisco 49ers (2021), Miami Dolphins (2022) and Buffalo Bills (2023).
In his career, has hauled in 78 receptions for 930 yards, averaging 11.9 yards per catch, and five touchdowns.
Posted single-season career highs in receptions (30), receiving yards (417) and receiving touchdowns (two) in 17 games played, including four starts, with the Dolphins in 2022.

name: Jihad Ward
bio: Played in 102 regular-season games with 35 starts for Oakland Raiders (2016-17), Indianapolis Colts (2018-19), Baltimore Ravens (2019-20), Jacksonville Jaguars (2021), and New York Giants (2022-23).
Played in five postseason games, including one start for the Ravens (2019-20) and the Giants (2022).

Career totals include 158 total tackles, including 24 for loss, 18.0 sacks, seven passes defensed, three forced fumbles and four fumble recoveries. In postseason play, has eight total tackles, including two tackles for loss.
In the past two seasons with the Giants, Ward started 20 games and totaled 8.0 sacks, including a career-high 5.0 in 2023.
Played in 102 regular-season games with 35 starts for Oakland Raiders (2016-17), Indianapolis Colts (2018-19), Baltimore Ravens (2019-20), Jacksonville Jaguars (2021), and New York Giants (2022-23).

Career totals include 158 total tackles, including 24 for loss, 18.0 sacks, seven passes defensed, three forced fumbles and four fumble recoveries. In postseason play, has eight total tackles, including two tackles for loss.
In the past two seasons with the Giants, Ward started 20 games and totaled 8.0 sacks, including a career-high 5.0 in 2023.

name: Andrew Van Ginkel
bio: Drafted in the fifth round of the 2019 NFL Draft, Brian Flores' first draft class as the head coach of the Miami Dolphins.

Started 42 of the 73 games he played in five seasons (2019-23) with the Miami Dolphins and recorded 250 total tackles, including 31 for loss, 17.0 sacks, one interception, four forced fumbles and three fumble recoveries (one returned for a touchdown).
Returned a fumble 78 yards for a touchdown during the 2020 season, the second-longest fumble return by a Dolphin all-time.
During the 2022 season, recovered a blocked punt and returned it 25 yards for a touchdown, marking the longest blocked punt returned for a touchdown in franchise history.

name: Levi Drake Rodriguez
bio: Minnesota's fourth selection out of Texas A&M Commerce all-time and first since LB Antonio Wilson was picked in the fourth round of 2000 NFL Draft.
He is the 54th all-time player drafted out of Texas A&M Commerce and the first selcted in an NFL Draft since Wilson in 2000.

name: Bo Richter
bio: Spent five seasons at Air Force (2019-23), appearing in 36 contests. Tallied 85 total tackles, including 26.5 for loss, 11.5 sacks, one interception, two passes defensed, three forced fumbles and two fumble recoveries.
Posted single-season career highs in total tackles (45), tackles for loss (19.5), sacks (10.0), forced fumbles (three) and fumble recoveries (two) in a season-high 13 games played.
In 2022, registered 26 total tackles, including 5.5 for loss, in 12 games played.
In 2021, played in 11 games, starting the final two games of the season, and recorded 14 total tackles, including 1.5 for loss, 1.5 sacks, one interception and a pass defensed.
Did not see action during the 2019 and 2020 seasons.

bio: Minnesota's 12th selection out of Oklahoma all-time and the first Sooner selected by the Vikings since LB Brian Asamoah II in the third round (66th overall) of the 2022 NFL Draft.

name: Will Reichard
bio: First kicker selected in the 2024 NFL Draft.
Minnesota's eighth pick out of Alabama all-time and second of the 2024 NFL Draft, joining Dallas Turner (No. 17 Overall).
Seventh kicker drafted by the Vikings and first since Daniel Carlson in 2018.
Became just the second kicker all-time selected out of Alabama joining David Ray, who was drafted by the Cleveland Browns in 1966.

name: Jalen Redmond
bio: Spent training camp with the Carolina Panthers in 2023.
Signed with the UFL's Arlington Renegades in the spring of 2024, where he appeared in four games and recorded 18 total tackles, including five for loss, and 4.5 sacks.

name: Dalton Risner
bio: Appeared in 15 games in his first season with the Vikings, starting each of the final 11 contests.
Played 100% of the Vikings offensive snaps in Weeks 15-17.
Started at Las Vegas in Week 14, missing a handful of snaps after exiting with an injury. He eventually returned to the game.
Played 100% of Minnesota's offensive snaps in each of the first six games he started this season (Weeks 7-12).
Made his first-career start for the Vikings, starting at left guard against San Francisco in Week 7 (10/23).
Played his first offensive snaps as a Viking in Week 6 at Chicago, entering the game when starting LG Ezra Cleveland left the field with an injury.
Made his Vikings debut in Week 3 against the Chargers, seeing action on special teams.

name: Jalen Nailor
bio: Battled injuries during the 2023 season, appearing in just six games, including one start.
Inactive at Cincinnati in Week 15 (12/16), against Detroit in Week 16 (12/24) and against Green Bay in Week 17 (12/31) due to injury.
Made his first-career start in Week 10 against New Orleans (11/12). He caught one pass for 16 yards.
Activated to the 53-man roster prior to Week 9 at Atlanta (11/5), but was inactive for the game.
Placed on Reserve/Injured and missed Weeks 3-8.
Made his season debut against Tampa Bay (9/10) and made a tackle on special teams.

name: Johnny Mundt
bio: Played in all 17 of the Vikings games in 2023, recording a single-season career high 172 receiving yards on 17 catches.

Posted single-game career highs in both receptions (five) and receiving yards (58) at Detroit in Week 18 (1/7). His 32-yard reception at the end of the first quarter marked the second longest of his career and his longest since Oct. 26, 2020.

In Week 17 against Green Bay (12/31), scored his first touchdown of the season and the second of his career, hauling in a 6-yard pass from QB Nick Mullens. He finished with a career-high four receptions for 39 yards. His 39 receiving yards marked the second most of his career.
Had a 23-yard reception against Detroit in Week 16 (12/24), his longest catch this season and the third longest of his career.
Has appeared in all 14 games to start the season.
Caught two passes for eight yards in Week 10 against New Orleans (11/12).
Hauled in an 18-yard reception at Atlanta (11/5), his longest since joining the Vikings.
Caught one pass for eight yards at Green Bay in Week 8 (10/29).
Collected his first catch of the season in Week 5 against Kansas City (10/8).

name: Josh Oliver
bio: Appeared in all 17 games (14 starts) in 2023, producing career highs in receptions (22) and receiving yards (213) and tying his single-season career best in touchdown receptions (two).
Recorded career highs in receiving yards (76) – including a career-long 40-yarder – while hauling a 12-yard TD reception at Jacksonville (11/27/22).
Collected his first-career TD grab on a 1-yard reception from QB Lamar Jackson in the 37-26 win at New England (9/25/22).
In 2021, saw action in 14 games (one start) in his first year as a Baltimore Raven, registering nine catches for 66 yards.
Helped block for the NFL's sixth-ranked offense (378.8 ypg) and third-best rushing attack (145.8 ypg), also adding three special teams tackles.

name: Harrison Phillips
bio: Started all 17 of the Minnesota Vikings games in 2023, totaling 92 tackles and 3.0 sacks - both of which were single-season career bests - six quarterback hurries and a pair of passes defensed.
Finished sixth on the team in tackles (92). His 92 tackles were the second most in the NFL among all defensive lineman trailing only Derrick Brown (103).
Against Detroit in Week 16 (12/24), notched eight tackles, tied for the third most among all Viking defenders.
Registered his third sack on the season at Las Vegas in Week 14 (12/10). Also had four tackles, including one for loss, and a quarterback hurry.
Tied for the second-most tackles among Viking defenders with five in Week 10 against New Orleans (11/12).
At Green Bay in Week 8 (10/29), had eight tackles and 0.5 sack. Also logged two quarterback hurries.
Recorded four tackles against San Francisco in Week 7 (10/23).
Notched a pair of tackles and a quarterback hit agains the Chargers in Week 3.
Against the Eagles (9/14), logged a career-high 13 total tackles, including 0.5 sack.
Started the season opener against Tampa Bay (9/10), recording eight total tackles, tied for the second-highest single-game total of his career. Also added a pass defensed in Week 1.

name: Dan Feeney
bio: Joined the Vikings following stints with the Chargers (2017-20), New York Jets (2021-22), Miami Dolphins (2023) and Chicago Bears (2023).

Teammates with Vikings DL Jerry Tillery while with the Los Angeles Chargers during the 2019 and 2020 seasons, and teammates with Vikings LB Blake Cashman during the 2021 season with the New York Jets.
Appeared in 112 games during his first seven seasons in the NFL, making 65 starts, including 40 at left guard and 21 at center.
Has started each of the playoff games he has played at left guard - AFC Wild Card Game against the Ravens and AFC Divisional Game against the Patriots.
From 2017-20, was a three-year starter for the Chargers, making 57 consecutive starts with 39 coming at left guard and 18 at center.

name: Ty Chandler
bio: Became just the fifth running back in the past five seasons (2019-23) to log at least 130 rushing yards and a touchdown during the first start of a players NFL career with his performance at Cincinnati in Week 15 (12/16).

Became just the fifth running back in the past five seasons (2019-23) to log at least 130 rushing yards and a touchdown during the first start of a players NFL career with his performance at Cincinnati in Week 15 (12/16).

name: Blake Cashman
bio: In three seasons with the New York Jets (2019-21), started seven of the 14 games he played, registering 49 total tackles, including three for loss, 0.5 sack, one pass defensed and a fumble recovery.

Spent two seasons with the Houston Texans (2022-23) and totaled 132 combined tackles, including 13 for loss, 5.0 sacks, one interception, seven passes defensed and a pair of fumble recoveries in 30 games played, including 14 starts.

Joined Patrick Willis (2007) and Shaquille Leonard (2018) as the only players in NFL history to record at least 19 tackles, 1.0 sack and one pass defensed in a single game with his performance in Week 11 against Arizona in 2023.

name: Stephon Gilmore
bio: Two-time All-Pro (2018-19) and five-time Pro Bowler (2016, 2018-21).
Prior to joining the Vikings, spent time with the Buffalo Bills (2012-16), New England Patriots (2017-20), Carolina Panthers (2021), Indianapolis Colts (2022) and Dallas Cowboys (2023).
Named the
NFL Defensive Player of the Year in 2019 after leading the league in passes defensed (20) and tying for the league lead in interceptions (six), including returning two for touchdowns.
Became the first Patriots player to earn AP NFL Defensive Player of the Year honors and the first cornerback to win the award since Charles Woodson in 2009.

name: Nick Mullens
bio: Had three games with at least 300 passing yards during the 2023 season, the most in a single season in his career.
Appeared in one contest for the Browns in 2021, spending most of the year on the team's practice squad.

Played in a career-high 10 games with eight starts for the 49ers in 2020, setting career highs in pass attempts (326), completions (211), completion percentage (64.7 percent) and passing yards (2,437).
In 2019, was active for all 16 contests and served as the backup quarterback with San Francisco.
Started eight contests in 2018, registering career highs in passing TDs (13) and passer rating (90.8).
Has appeared in 20 games with 17 starts over his four-year career, completing 407-of-630 attempts for 4,861 yards with 26 touchdowns against 22 interceptions for a passer rating of 87.3.

name: Andrew DePaola
bio: Named as a starter for the Pro Bowl for a second-consecutive season. First long snapper to earn back-to-back Pro Bowl honors since Rams LS Jake McQuaide in 2016 and 2017.
Handled all long-snapping duties for the Vikings in 2023.
Helped RB Ty Chandler execute two successful fake punts during the 2023 season, including Chandler's 31-yard run on a fake punt at Denver in Week 11, the fourth-longest fake punt in franchise history

name: Camryn Bynum
bio: Transitioned from cornerback in college to safety in the NFL.
Has played in 48 games with 37 starts in his first three seasons in the NFL, becoming a full-time starter in 2022 and playing 100 percent of the defensive snaps that season.
During the 2023 season, led all Vikings defenders with 137 tackles, the most by a DB league wide. Among all defenders, he finished 14th in the league.

name: Sam Darnold
bio: In three seasons with the New York Jets (2018-20), started all 38 games he played and threw for 8,097 yards and 45 touchdowns. Added 417 rushing yards and five touchdowns on 114 carries.

With the Carolina Panthers (2021-22), started 17 of the 18 games he appeared in and recorded 3,670 passing yards and 16 touchdowns. Also scored seven touchdowns on the ground, rushing for 328 yards on 74 attempts.
In one season with the San Francisco 49ers, appeared in 10 contests (one start) and was 28-of-46 for 297 yards, two touchdowns and one interception.

name: Blake Brandel
bio: Saw action in every game for the Vikings during the 2023 season, including making two starts.
Started his second game of the season in Week 18 at Detroit (1/7), playing 100% of the offensive snaps at RG.
Made his first start of the season in Week 14 at Las Vegas (12/10), playing 100% of the offensive snaps at RG.
Active Weeks 1-12 and 15-16, appearing on special teams.

name: Brian Asamoah II
bio: Had the second-most defensive snaps among the Vikings 2022 draft class (cornerback Akayleb Evans, 159), appearing in 116. He totaled 15 tackles with one forced fumble and a fumble recovery. Also had two special teams tackles.

name: Jonathan Bullard
bio: Started 14 of the 17 games he appeared in for the Vikings in 2023, registering a career-high 44 tackles, including three for loss, 2.0 sacks, also a single-season career high, and one forced fumble.
Registered his second sack this season in Week 15 at Cincinnati (12/16), setting a career high for sacks in a single season.
Against New Orleans in Week 10 (11/12), recorded a strip sack in the third quarter, marking his first sack of the season and first full sack since Sept. 29, 2019.
Season-high seven tackles vs. Kansas City (10/8), tying his career high from 10/6/19 at Cincinnati.
Registered a tackle on a crucial fourth down stop late in the game vs. Los Angeles Chargers (9/24).
Started and tallied four tackles vs. Tampa Bay (9/10) in Week 1.

Registered a tackle on a crucial fourth down stop late in the game vs. Los Angeles Chargers (9/24).
Started and tallied four tackles vs. Tampa Bay (9/10) in Week 1.

name: Garrett Bradbury
bio: Started all 71 games in which he appeared for through his first five seasons in the NFL.
Named the Vikings 2019 Rookie of the Year as part of the annual Minnesota Football Honors program.
The third N.C. State player selected in the first round by the Vikings, joining RB Ted Brown in 1979 (16th overall) and CB Dewayne Washington in 1994 (18th overall).

Named the Vikings 2019 Rookie of the Year as part of the annual Minnesota Football Honors program.
